In an interview with the Post, whistleblower Chris Wylie, a former Cambridge Analytica employee, said Bannon was deeply involved with the company's data-gathering efforts.
Former Trump strategist Steve Bannon oversaw the early collection of Facebook user data for Cambridge Analytica in 2014, the Washington Post reported late Tuesday.
Cambridge Analytica allegedly mined data from 50 million Facebook users without their consent for use during the 2016 presidential campaign.
Bannon helped launch Cambridge Analytica in 2013 with the financial backing of conservative mega-donor Robert Mercer.
